verses.name: Job 29:1
verses.text: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

verses.name: Job 29:2
verses.text: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

verses.name: Job 29:3
verses.text: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

verses.name: Job 29:4
verses.text: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;

verses.name: Job 29:5
verses.text: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

verses.name: Job 29:6
verses.text: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

verses.name: Job 29:7
verses.text: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

verses.name: Job 29:8
verses.text: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

verses.name: Job 29:9
verses.text: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

verses.name: Job 29:10
verses.text: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

verses.name: Job 29:11
verses.text: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

verses.name: Job 29:12
verses.text: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

verses.name: Job 29:13
verses.text: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.

verses.name: Job 29:14
verses.text: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

verses.name: Job 29:15
verses.text: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

verses.name: Job 29:16
verses.text: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

verses.name: Job 29:17
verses.text: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

verses.name: Job 29:18
verses.text: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

verses.name: Job 29:19
verses.text: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.

verses.name: Job 29:20
verses.text: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

verses.name: Job 29:21
verses.text: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

verses.name: Job 29:22
verses.text: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

verses.name: Job 29:23
verses.text: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

verses.name: Job 29:24
verses.text: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

verses.name: Job 29:25
verses.text: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
